labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed primarily for managing X (Twitter) social media operations. It provides tools to search tweets, generate replies, and post content (both tweets and replies). The server's core functionality revolves around automation and streamlining social media management tasks, particularly on Twitter. It appears to focus on content generation and engagement to "post bangers" (high-quality/impactful tweets or replies).
labels.reasoning: The primary focus on Twitter/X management aligns it most closely with the "Social Media" category. Secondary labels of "Content Creation" and "Daily Productivity" are appropriate because the server helps generate and post content (Content Creation) while also automating repetitive tasks (Daily Productivity). No custom label is needed as the predefined categories cover the server's functionality well.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

Get unlimited data
Generate quality content
Post bangers

X (Twitter)

Need an API key? Send support message (bottom right): https://apexagents.ai/mcp

tools.description: Deploy Server X (Twitter) Management @xonack/apex-mcp Try in Playground

tools.name: generate_reply
tools.description: Tool that generates a reply to a message.

tools.name: generate_reply_to_tweet
tools.description: A tool to generate a reply suggestion to a tweet. Use if you don't have any context to generate a reply yet.

tools.name: post_reply_to_tweet
tools.description: Tool that posts a reply to a tweet with input text & optional image.

tools.name: search_tweets
tools.description: A tool to search for tweets by a given query.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@xonack/apex-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
